DOC.HEAD: Roseanne Barr Suffering Exhaustion, Cancels Shows
DOC.TEXT: Comedian Roseanne Barr, who canceled her wedding plans last week and said her fiance had entered an alcohol and drug treatment clinic, Thursday pulled out of five theater performances, citing exhaustion. Barr, the stand-up comic and television sitcom star who recently made her first motion picture, ``has been forced to suspend all current activities,'' said Susan Pfeifer, spokeswoman for the Circle Star Center in San Carlos, south of San Francisco. ``Her doctor has insisted that in order to preserve her health, she reschedule all current engagements.'' Barr's spokeswoman, Lisa Kasteler in Los Angeles, confirmed that Barr was exhausted. ``She is at home and has not been hospitalized,'' Kasteler said. Last week, Barr, 36, called off her January 20 wedding to Tom Arnold, a former consultant to her show, ``Roseanne.'' Barr protested Arnold's firing from the show and has stated that she intends to leave television soon. Her first motion picture, ``She-Devil,'' with Meryl Streep, has been a box-office disappointment so far. The shows at the Circle Star, a 3,700-seat theater-in-the-round, were the only performances Barr had scheduled that were canceled, Kasteler said. The theater had sold out the first of the shows on Dec. 28 at $29.50 a ticket, and was close to selling out the others for prices up to $40 a ticket for New Year's Eve, Pfeifer said. ``Because of the late date, we don't know if we'll be able to schedule someone else those days,'' Pfeifer said. Barr rescheduled four of her performances for Feb. 22, 23 and 24, when she'll have two shows, but was unable to reschedule the Dec. 31 performance, Pfeifer said.
